articles.headline: As Economy Slows, Experts Call on China to Drop Growth Target
articles.snippet: A growing number of analysts say China’s practice of setting an annual target for growth actually hurts the economy and encourages officials to falsify data.
articles.abstract: A growing number of analysts say China’s practice of setting an annual target for growth actually hurts the economy and encourages officials to falsify data.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Every March, China releases a closely watched growth target for the year, a number that looms large for the world’s economists, executives and policy makers. But a growing number of those experts are now calling for China to stop setting that goal, saying the target actually harms the economy and encourages officials to falsify data.

articles.headline: Tax Tips for Those Who Make Money in the Gig Economy
articles.snippet: The gig economy is reshaping the work world for many Americans. It is also reshaping tax season. Here is what the newly self-employed need to know.
articles.abstract: The gig economy is reshaping the work world for many Americans. It is also reshaping tax season. Here is what the newly self-employed need to know.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since losing her job in advertising during the financial crisis, Dina Scherer has spent her days helping women cultivate their own personal styles — finding flattering color palettes, editing closets and taking customers on shopping excursions.

articles.headline: A Troubling Timeline at Valeant
articles.snippet: A growing trickle of head-scratching news adds to gaps in Valeant Pharmaceuticals’ financial disclosures, despite attempts to burnish results.
articles.abstract: A growing trickle of head-scratching news adds to gaps in Valeant Pharmaceuticals’ financial disclosures, despite attempts to burnish results.
articles.lead_paragraph: As one surprising announcement after another has unspooled in recent months at Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, its shareholders may well have thought they were watching Abbott and Costello performing the comedy skit “Who’s on First?”

articles.headline: Architect of Pipeline Company Merger Said to Be Its Foe
articles.snippet: Energy Transfer Equity’s former chief financial officer has been working behind the scenes to fight the deal, some Williams shareholders said.
articles.abstract: Energy Transfer Equity’s former chief financial officer has been working behind the scenes to fight the deal, some Williams shareholders said.
articles.lead_paragraph: In late January, about 40 Wall Street financiers packed into a private dining room at III Forks Steakhouse in Houston for an update on the troubled multibillion-dollar merger of the pipeline companies Energy Transfer Equity and the Williams Companies.
articles.byline: By Leslie Picker and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: At RSA Conference, Unlikely Allies Address Value of Digital Security
articles.snippet: Given Apple’s dispute with the F.B.I., what surprised many at the world’s largest gathering of security experts was the nuanced tone of former government officials.
articles.abstract: Given Apple’s dispute with the F.B.I., what surprised many at the world’s largest gathering of security experts was the nuanced tone of former government officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — To Amit Yoran, a digital security veteran, the fight between Apple and the F.B.I. over access to an iPhone can be viewed in black-and-white terms: What law enforcement authorities want is “so misguided, they simply boggle the mind.”

articles.headline: Ted Cruz Promoted Himself and Conservative Causes as Texas’ Solicitor General
articles.snippet: Mr. Cruz turned the solicitor’s office into a defender of the right wing and he made crucial friends in Texas — though he once angered Bush family allies.
articles.abstract: Mr. Cruz turned the solicitor’s office into a defender of the right wing and he made crucial friends in Texas — though he once angered Bush family allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — From its start in 1999, the office of the solicitor general of Texas was run by a plain-spoken Mormon, a by-the-books lawyer known for mentoring young attorneys and defending the state, whatever the political consequences.

articles.headline: Clinton Offers Economic Plan Focused on Jobs
articles.snippet: Hillary Clinton, campaigning in Michigan before the Tuesday primary, also offered proposals to strip tax benefits from companies that move jobs overseas.
articles.abstract: Hillary Clinton, campaigning in Michigan before the Tuesday primary, also offered proposals to strip tax benefits from companies that move jobs overseas.
articles.lead_paragraph: In an election year defined by angry populism, Hillary Clinton made an optimistic economic pitch on Friday, presenting a wide-ranging plan for job growth that would provide incentives for corporations that invest in employees and strip tax benefits from companies that move jobs overseas.

articles.headline: Rank and File Republicans Tell Party Elites: We’re Sticking With Donald Trump
articles.snippet: The appeal from Mitt Romney and the furious reaction to it captured the essence of the party’s schism.
articles.abstract: The appeal from Mitt Romney and the furious reaction to it captured the essence of the party’s schism.
articles.lead_paragraph: From Michigan to Louisiana to California on Friday, rank-and-file Republicans expressed mystification, dismissal and contempt over the instructions that their party’s most high-profile leaders were urgently handing down to them: Reject and defeat Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Ashley Parker and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: A Biotech Evangelist Seeks a Zika Dividend
articles.snippet: A diverse biotechnology company hopes its genetically engineered mosquitoes can help stop the spread of a devastating virus. But that’s just a start.
articles.abstract: A diverse biotechnology company hopes its genetically engineered mosquitoes can help stop the spread of a devastating virus. But that’s just a start.
articles.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — In the expanding realm ruled by Randal J. Kirk, sliced apples don’t brown. Salmon grow twice as fast without swimming upriver to spawn. Beloved cats are reborn.

articles.headline: Ted Cruz Keeps Up Pressure on Donald Trump; Bernie Sanders Takes 2 on ‘Super Saturday’
articles.snippet: The hunt for delegates resumed Saturday with Republican contests in Kansas, Louisiana, Maine and Kentucky, and Democratic ones in Kansas, Louisiana and Nebraska.
articles.abstract: The hunt for delegates resumed Saturday with Republican contests in Kansas, Louisiana, Maine and Kentucky, and Democratic ones in Kansas, Louisiana and Nebraska.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Ted Cruz scored decisive wins in the Kansas and Maine caucuses on Saturday, demonstrating his enduring appeal among conservatives as he tried to reel in Donald J. Trump’s significant lead in the Republican presidential race.

articles.headline: Airbnb Pits Neighbor Against Neighbor in Tourist-Friendly New Orleans
articles.snippet: Opponents complain that short-term strangers squeeze out long-term residents, but supporters say renting out rooms allows them to make extra income.
articles.abstract: Opponents complain that short-term strangers squeeze out long-term residents, but supporters say renting out rooms allows them to make extra income.
articles.lead_paragraph: Talk to the locals in certain New Orleans neighborhoods — from the historic and genteel Garden District uptown to the dense and increasingly trendy Bywater downriver — and you can be pretty sure that one topic will come up eventually: Airbnb.

articles.headline: Competing Interests on Encryption Divide Top Obama Officials
articles.snippet: While the White House denies any internal disagreement over its legal battle with Apple, the differences in the administration have become increasingly apparent.
articles.abstract: While the White House denies any internal disagreement over its legal battle with Apple, the differences in the administration have become increasingly apparent.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The intensifying legal battle over encryption between Apple and the Justice Department has all but obscured another more subtle division, the one inside the Obama administration itself.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Money Given to Kenya, Since Stolen, Puts Nike in Spotlight
articles.snippet: According to email exchanges, letters, bank records and invoices, Nike’s attempt to maintain sponsorship of Kenya’s runners has precipitated a scandal.
articles.abstract: According to email exchanges, letters, bank records and invoices, Nike’s attempt to maintain sponsorship of Kenya’s runners has precipitated a scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — When a Chinese clothing company swooped in and offered to sponsor Kenya’s famed runners, Nike panicked, Kenyan officials say.

articles.headline: It’s Discounted, but Is It a Deal? How List Prices Lost Their Meaning
articles.snippet: When the same skillet costs $200 at a dozen web stores, the bargain isn’t so obvious to consumers, and scrutiny of this practice is growing.
articles.abstract: When the same skillet costs $200 at a dozen web stores, the bargain isn’t so obvious to consumers, and scrutiny of this practice is growing.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — As traditional retailing falters, shutting stores and shedding workers, online merchants are reaping the rewards. People like the convenience of e-commerce, and they love the feeling that they are getting a deal.

articles.headline: Nancy Reagan, an Influential and Protective First Lady, Dies at 94
articles.snippet: Mrs. Reagan was a fierce guardian of her husband’s image, sometimes at the expense of her own, and a trusted adviser to Ronald Reagan.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Reagan was a fierce guardian of her husband’s image, sometimes at the expense of her own, and a trusted adviser to Ronald Reagan.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nancy Reagan, the influential and stylish wife of the 40th president of the United States who unabashedly put Ronald Reagan at the center of her life but became a political figure in her own right, died on Sunday at her home in Los Angeles. She was 94.

articles.headline: Law Graduate Gets Her Day in Court, Suing Law School
articles.snippet: For the first time, a law school will stand trial on charges that it inflated the employment data for its graduates to lure prospective students.
articles.abstract: For the first time, a law school will stand trial on charges that it inflated the employment data for its graduates to lure prospective students.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nearly a decade has passed since an aspiring young lawyer in California, Anna Alaburda, graduated in the top tier of her class, passed the state bar exam and set out to use the law degree she had spent about $150,000 to acquire.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Goes Astray on Guantánamo. So Does Obama.
articles.snippet: Many claims on both sides of the debate over the future of the prison in Cuba collapse under scrutiny.
articles.abstract: Many claims on both sides of the debate over the future of the prison in Cuba collapse under scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even by the standards of an epically polarized Washington, the political talk about President Obama’s effort to close the Guantá namo Bay prison is starkly divorced from facts. On both sides of the debate, many claims collapse under scrutiny.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Scott Shane

articles.headline: Tech Companies, New and Old, Clamor to Entice Cloud Computing Experts
articles.snippet: As some tech sectors show signs of slowing, cloud services have created remarkable demand for highly educated engineers and mathematicians. And they are being compensated very well.
articles.abstract: As some tech sectors show signs of slowing, cloud services have created remarkable demand for highly educated engineers and mathematicians. And they are being compensated very well.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Amazon Web Services, a globe-spanning cloud computing network that is part of the online retailing giant Amazon, has rapidly become one of the most powerful forces in technology. It has also become a target for poachers.

articles.headline: Tripoli, a Tense and Listless City With Gunmen and a Well-Stocked Hugo Boss Outlet
articles.snippet: As conflict rages elsewhere in Libya, a precarious order holds in the capital, as heavily armed militias and politicians, nominally allied, vie for control.
articles.abstract: As conflict rages elsewhere in Libya, a precarious order holds in the capital, as heavily armed militias and politicians, nominally allied, vie for control.
articles.lead_paragraph: TRIPOLI, Libya — Cracking open the giant church door, the Nigerian watchman cast a wary eye over the deserted street.

articles.headline: Heroin Epidemic Increasingly Seeps Into Public View
articles.snippet: As heroin use soars, people are routinely being found unconscious in public places like the bathrooms of fast-food restaurants, libraries and churches.
articles.abstract: As heroin use soars, people are routinely being found unconscious in public places like the bathrooms of fast-food restaurants, libraries and churches.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — In Philadelphia last spring, a man riding a city bus at rush hour injected heroin into his hand, in full view of other passengers, including one who captured the scene on video.

articles.headline: Picture This: Marketers Let Emojis Do the Talking
articles.snippet: Companies are employing their own custom-made images on social media; one even encoded an entire news release.
articles.abstract: Companies are employing their own custom-made images on social media; one even encoded an entire news release.
articles.lead_paragraph: The condom brand Durex has used World AIDS Day as a marketing hook for years, but for the most recent edition it tried something different: a condom emoji.

articles.headline: Taking Baby Steps Toward Software That Reasons Like Humans
articles.snippet: A number of start-ups are developing a new generation of pattern recognition software that is slowly and steadily advancing artificial intelligence.
articles.abstract: A number of start-ups are developing a new generation of pattern recognition software that is slowly and steadily advancing artificial intelligence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Richard Socher appeared nervous as he waited for his artificial intelligence program to answer a simple question: “Is the tennis player wearing a cap?”

articles.headline: Money Pours In as Move to Stop Donald Trump Expands
articles.snippet: Republicans hoping to halt Donald J. Trump’s march to the nomination emerged from the weekend newly emboldened by his uneven electoral performance and by some signs that he may be peaking with voters.
articles.abstract: Republicans hoping to halt Donald J. Trump’s march to the nomination emerged from the weekend newly emboldened by his uneven electoral performance and by some signs that he may be peaking with voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republicans hoping to halt Donald J. Trump’s march to their party’s presidential nomination emerged from the weekend’s voting contests newly emboldened by Mr. Trump’s uneven electoral performance and by some nascent signs that he may be peaking with voters.
articles.byline: By Matt Flegenheimer and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: The Right Wing’s Casting Agency, and Its Agent
articles.snippet: As executive director of Talent Market, Claire Kittle Dixon uses her vast connections to fill posts for prominent and obscure conservative organizations.
articles.abstract: As executive director of Talent Market, Claire Kittle Dixon uses her vast connections to fill posts for prominent and obscure conservative organizations.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Over the last year, the Lynde and Harry Bradley Foundation, a Milwaukee group that has financed decades of research into curbing the power of public sector unions, hired three new staff members: a fund-raiser, an administrative aide and a program officer.
